abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Education Sector Restructuring Project
            in Mauritania. This project was aimed to: (a) correct
            distortions in resource allocations and use in the education
            sector; (b) increase access to, and improve the quality, of
            primary education, and improve; (c) the quality of science
            teaching in secondary and higher education; (d) the quality
            and relevance of technical and vocational education; and (e)
            education sector planning and management capacities.
            Bank's performance was satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was satisfactory. The key lessons learned were
            as follows: (i) the approach to community participation
            whereby participation was not limited to contributions in
            cash or in-kind, but encompassed community management of the
            construction process, including financial management; (ii)
            verifiable and transparent criteria for the allocation of
            funds; (iii) simple disbursement procedures which allowed
            rapid reimbursements to communities for work completed; (iv)
            good technical support services provided to communities; and
            (v) strong local support for the program.
